creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
description: Mishima Bowl; all-over comb motif with five flowers in interior and band of flowers circling sides; pottery with grey glaze, stoneware
medium: Buncheong ware; earthenware with slip and underglaze iron brown
text: The mode of decoration on this bowl is known as “rope curtain,” because the rows of densely stamped circles resemble the thick, twisted rope curtain hung across doorways.
title: Bowl with Stamped Comb Design and Flowers
